overview:
## Return Value

The resolved attachment entity, or `nil` if [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView] can’t find an attachment view with the given `id`.

## Discussion

Attachment entities are not automatically added to your [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView]’s content. To display an attachment, add it to your [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView]’s content using a function like `RealityViewContent/add(_:)`.

# entity(for:)

**Instance Method**

Gets the identified attachment view as an entity, if the view with that identifier exists.

## Declaration

```swift
func entity(for id: some Hashable) -> ViewAttachmentEntity?
```

## Parameters

- **id**: The value that you used to tag the view when you define it in the `attachments` parameter of the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView] initializer [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView/init(make:update:attachments:)].

## Return Value

The resolved attachment entity, or `nil` if [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView] can’t find an attachment view with the given `id`.

## Discussion

Attachment entities are not automatically added to your [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView]’s content. To display an attachment, add it to your [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView]’s content using a function like `RealityViewContent/add(_:)`.
